message.content:
cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with learning equilibria in simulation-based games, which involves designing learning algorithms that can find (approximate) equilibria with high confidence, using as few simulator queries as possible. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and game theory (cs.GT). The paper also mentions the use of Gaussian processes, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper discusses the need for the algorithms to perform a pure exploration learning phase, which is a characteristic of multi-agent systems (cs.MA) and control systems (cs.SY).
